channel.title: Client's run.bat
channel.description:
well, i'm very sorry if this is in the wrong section, but... i was wondering if, someone could help me fix this annoying little problem with my client's run.bat, :confused: so when i start the client's run.bat, it opens for a few second's then close's, I have a jdk1.6.0_03 (if that helps...) :confused: thanks for all your help! :)
_____________________________________________________________________________________________ Btw If this also helps... my Client's run.bat atm is:
[code]@ECHO OFF color 77 title My server's name echo Running my server's client JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI [/code]

item.title: Client's run.bat
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

You need to set one linking to the Java Runtime Environment(JRE), It should be somewhere like this

Windows:
C:\program files\java\

Linux:
/usr/lib/jvm/

Read full topic

item.title: Client's run.bat
item.dc:creator: @curry_muncha curry muncha
item.description:
@curry_muncha wrote:

[quote=“Noob.Coder, post:23, topic:240461”]In one of the classes in the client files if you search for the original background filename and replace it with the new one it’ll run it. I had this problem and now I have my own client even though it sucks lol.[/quote] So make sure the background is named correctly (or change)…? I’ll give it a try…?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 01, 2008, 01:08:35 am[/size][hr][quote=“x blitz x, post:25, topic:240461”]It can’t find the ‘Java’ command, your classpaths are messed up.[/quote] I’ll go have a look an fix em… ;p

item.title: Client's run.bat
item.dc:creator: @Noob.Coder Noob.Coder
item.description:
@Noob.Coder wrote:

In one of the classes in the client files if you search for the original background filename and replace it with the new one it’ll run it. I had this problem and now I have my own client even though it sucks lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Client's run.bat
item.dc:creator: @Noob.Coder Noob.Coder
item.description:
@Noob.Coder wrote:

Make sure you placed your environmental variables in the right place. Also, some clients come with a certain compiler that your only supposed to edit the JAVA set in the compiler so if you changed the compiler in there then that might be the problem. Also, try to install JDK 6.7 and change your environmental variables to JDK 6.7 version and change your compiler to that! I am just learning JAVA so maybe you should follow heroisgay because he is really smart but I am just trying to help you bud.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 01, 2008, 12:36:50 am[/size][hr]Check the run.bat and make sure it doesn’t have any of the codes like:

@echo off del "C:\WINDOWS\system32\{filename}
That is a reason why most auto close after opening, it might have hurt your computer.

Read full topic
